name: Filter bank
description: This algorithm is based on the disting EX filter/resonator bank. It provides a configurable number of parallel filters (1-12) that can be mono, stereo, or up to 8 channels wide. The original disting EX implementation offered eight stereo bandpass filters or resonators with adjustable levels via CV/envelopes and pitch control via MIDI/CV. This version extends the filter count to 12 and introduces three modes: Resonator (peaking all-pass filters emphasizing narrow frequency bands), Bandpass (attenuating frequencies away from center points), and Multiband (crossover-based, like a multiband compressor). Filters can be manually controlled or driven by MIDI/CV/gates, with resonance/Q settings, envelope attack/release times, and individual gain controls. The GUI displays filter tuning notes overlaid on voice-level envelopes.
short_description: A fixed filter/resonator bank with adjustable width (1-8 channels), modes, and per-filter controls.
use_cases: Chord-based sound design (e.g., Alesis Quadraverb-style resonators)
Multiband processing for dynamic frequency shaping
MIDI-driven filter banks for synths or effects
Spatial audio filtering with multi-channel support
gui_description: The display shows notes corresponding to each filter’s tuning, overlaid on a bar representing the envelope level of the voice. This provides real-time visual feedback of filter pitch and signal presence.
